lorebooks.creator: panasane

1.content:
There are many schools of magic, the most notable include: Warp, Graviturgy, Chronomancy, Enchantment, Conjuration, Necromancy, Elemental, Vitalization, Evocation, Transmutation, Animurgy.

Typically those capable of using magic will specialize in one school, being far more familiar and capable with the magic of their chosen school than any other school, often being entirely incapable of using any magic from schools other than their chosen one.

2.content:
Spells are commands that magic users use to manipulate the forces of magic for a desired effect. To use magic, one must 'cast' a spell. Caster is the term for someone who cast a spell.

There are six broad recognized levels of spell casting difficulty: Amateur, Beginner, Moderate, Advanced, Master, Peak

Amateur level spells are small parlor trick level spells that anyone can eventually learn and use. They require next to no magical ability.

Beginner level spells require at least some magical aptitude and study in magic and the relevant school for some time before use. The average professional magic user knows many beginner level spells. 

Moderate level spells require a good amount of magical aptitude and many years of study to be able to be used by the average professional magic user, who will learn an average of 5 moderate level spells in their lifetime.

Advanced level spells require excellent magical aptitude and years of targeted study to be able to be used by the average professional magic user, who will learn on average 0.5 advanced level spells in their lifetime.

Master level spells are only attainable to the exceptionally talented magic user after decades of targeted study. Those capable of learning such powerful spells are extremely rare.

Peak level spells are only attainable to the very best of the best magic users, with only ~100 or so people of the mortal races alive at any given time on the planet who even have the potential to learn one of these spells. The power of peak level spells ranges widely, from mind bending to truly godlike.

3.content: One who practices magic daily or close to it throughout their life and who's livelihood relies on the usage of magic, whether it be for offensive, educational, a trade, or any other such purposes.

4.content:
The school of Warp embodies the zenith of magical prowess, a realm steeped in enigma and fraught with peril. Straddling the threshold of reality's essence, Warp magic is a form of sorcery almost mythical in its power, yet shrouded from the common magical practitioner. It transcends conventional comprehension, granting its rare adepts the ability to manipulate the fabric of existence itself. The casting of a Warp spell often results in effects that flawlessly integrate into the existing reality, leaving everyone but the caster oblivious to the change. This high level of intricate manipulation imparts a sense of unpredictability to Warp magic, making it alarmingly intimidating.

However, the formidable nature of Warp magic is intrinsically tied to its inherent risks. Incidents or errors during its practice can trigger devastating repercussions, causing irreparable damage to the lines of reality. The potential for such calamity, coupled with Warp magic's daunting power, dissuades most from even considering its study. Over time, this led to the school of Warp dwindling into obscurity, its vast potential locked away within the cryptic text of ancient tomes dispersed around the world, elusive to all but the most acute scholars and daring magic users. Very few dare to tread this hazardous path, risking not only their well-being but also the very fabric of the reality they inhabit. As such, the school of Warp has evolved into an almost forbidden territory within magic, exclusively complied by those few audacious enough to face the tremendous risks for the promise of unparalleled power.

The most powerful actions one can take with Warp magic are not found in spells or tomes, but in manipulating reality with the brute force of unfathomably immense magical power and a deep understanding of the intricacies of the school of Warp. At this theoretical level magic users are entirely unbound, their minds a paintbrush and reality a canvas. If any were to ever reach it they would be indistinguishable from a god.

5.content:
The school of Graviturgy stands as a testament to magic's limitless potential, embodying the raw power to reshape one of the universe's fundamental forces: gravity. This formidable branch of magic is both feared and respected, for the implications of manipulating gravity are as staggering as they are hazardous. Graviturgy isn‚Äôt just about defying or enforcing gravity; it's about understanding and reshaping its existence according to the caster's will, offering the possibility to create areas of intense gravitational pull or grant weightlessness to objects at will.

However, this exceptional power doesn't come without peril. Graviturgy is notoriously mercurial and untamed. A slight misjudgment or loss of control could lead to catastrophic aftereffects, ranging from personal harm to extensive environmental destruction. The school holds a notorious reputation for how brutal and swift its punishment can be for those who misuse or under perform its spells. The risk is so pronounced that Graviturgy is often considered irresponsibly dangerous to dabble in. Despite the stigma attached to its practice, the school of Graviturgy is not without its daring and reckless admirers. Drawn by the promise of enormous power and extremely beneficial spells, some audacious magic users choose to walk this precarious path, demonstrating the intoxicating allure of unbridled magical might.

6.content:
The school of Chronomancy, diverse and almost mystical, holds an elevated reputation as one of the most dangerous branches of magic, outclassed only by Warp magic in its potential for existential threat. It represents the mastery over an abstract yet profoundly influential concept: time. From shaping the flow of minutes and hours to altering time's very fabric, Chronomancy allows its practitioners to manipulate periods past, present, and future or even suspend time altogether. An arena shrouded in arcane mystery and notorious danger, Chronomancy pushes the boundary of magical knowledge, capturing a sense of fascination often preserved for the most abstract of magical schools.

However, the allure and might of manipulating time come with heavy risks. Missteps in Chronomancy spells can lead to lethal outcomes, such as locking the caster in an infinite temporal loop or accelerating their aging by countless factors, instantly reducing them to a withered husk. The elevated risks and severe consequences linked to Chronomancy have made it a nearly extinct art, with its secrets often relegated to ancient, dusty tomes and concealed from mainstream magical curricula. Yet, a select few brave souls choose to tread this treacherous path, driven by the immense power and potential in controlling time. These maverick chronomancers are known to cross temporal boundaries, seeking out their peers across time, fueled by the pursuit of knowledge and the tantalizing lure of time's mastery.

7.content:
Enchantment is a magical school that focuses on the imbuing of specific properties into objects or creatures, creating magical effects that can either be temporary or permanent. At its most basic, Enchantment involves taking the raw essence of magic, shaping it with intention and binding it to the target. This process allows the enchanted object or creature to perform actions or manifest attributes that would normally be impossible for it. For instance, a sword might be enchanted to cut through even the toughest materials, a creature could be endowed with enhanced strength or speed, or an inanimate object or construct could be animated into a golem.

The complexity and efficiency of enchantments depend on the skill and expertise of the enchanter. Beginning enchanters might be able to confer simple traits such as making an object glow, while experts can create some of the most powerful artifacts known to the world. Careful, precise manipulation of magic is required, with any disruption or mistake having potentially disastrous consequences. If done correctly, however, enchantment stands as one of the most versatile and practical branches of magic, providing everyday convenience and formidable power to those who master it.

8.content: Conjuration refers to the school of magic that involves summoning elements, creatures, or entities from other realms or dimensions. In most cases, the conjurer can call upon a varied spectrum of entities and objects ranging from simple household objects as well as basic materials and elements to complex, powerful beings such as familiars and elementals. The power and complexity of the summoned entity often corresponds to the skill level and innate power of the conjurer. Techniques of Conjuration may involve intricate rituals, the use of magical circles or the pronunciation of ancient, powerful words to rip apart the universe's fabric and pull the desired object or entity from its native plane.

9.content: The school of Necromancy is a dark, dreary domain that is immersed in the manipulation of death and the deceased. Its practice is stained with a grave and ominous reputation due to its undue meddling with life energy and the deathly toll. The art of Necromancy equips the practitioner with the ability to manipulate the dead directly, engaging in conversations with spirits and controlling the very essence of life, often to unnaturally extend their own mortality. Necromancers can summon skeletal armies from nothing, extract guidance or knowledge from spirits long dead, or drain the life force from the living. Their powers, however, do not come without peril. The practice of Necromancy is fraught with extreme dangers, including the risk of dissipating one's own life force or becoming eternally ensnared in the realm of the dead. Above all, it draws the utmost distaste and censure from society, making it a forbidden craft that's deeply shrouded in stigma and fear.

10.content:
The school of Elements is a unique discipline of magic focused on the manipulation and control of the primary elements - earth, air, fire, and water. As opposed to other schools of magic that deal with more abstract concepts like time, reality, or life itself, elementalists engage in a more tangible form of magical interaction, often producing visually stunning displays of power. Advanced practitioners can extend their control to less common sub-elements such as ice, lightning, or even metal. Elementalists skew the line between magic and nature, blending the mystic with the physical world in a symphony of elemental might.

Elementalists harness their connection to the world around them to command the elements. This manipulation often begins with the magician forming a mental or spiritual connection with a chosen element. Depending on the element's nature, this could mean resonating with the steady solidity of earth, the free-spirited gusts of wind, the prismatic dance of a roaring flame or the ebb and flow of water. Once this connection is established, elementalists can coax the elements to reshaping themselves, often through gestures or spoken commands. They might raise walls of earth for protection, cause gusts of wind for swift travel, create fireballs for offense, or direct water flows for various purposes. Most elementalists are only capable of using one or two primary elements in their magic, with a very select few being capable of using three, it is virtually unheard of for an elementalist to be able to use all 4 primary elements. Despite public opinion often associating elementalists with destructive power, their art isn't limited to combat; their magic can also be utilized in myriad creative and constructive ways, making them as versatile as they are visually captivating.

lorebooks.creator: Cowmoomer

1.content:
These creatures are an enigma ‚Äì a captivating yet terrifying juxtaposition. Despite their surreal beauty and mesmerizing forms, they strike fear into the hearts of all who encounter them.

They appear as anthropomorphic entities shrouded in white latex-like substance ‚Äì elegant yet uncanny with its near perfectly reflective surface shimmering under station lights casting unearthly glow around them. This lifeform layer follows their body contours closely revealing various shapes underneath ranging from sleek fox-styled vixens to hulking bovine behemoth forms‚Ä¶

Females become busty drones obscenely accentuating sensual curves hiding cruel intent while males turn into muscular enforcers looking intimidatingly unyielding even amidst this relatively peaceful invasion. Their faceless nature seems to add another layer of horror - no identifiable facial features but just smooth white expanse further emphasizing their alien origins.

However, it's not only physical form that fascinates but rather methodical manner they propagate through insidious assimilation methods. Close contact with a Boogie initiates chilling process: subjects being smoothly engulfed in latex casing before undergoing profound transformation aligning not only bodily attributes according to base template adopted by each Drone type but more importantly overwriting victim‚Äôs very consciousness until fully subservient drone-identity replaces individuals once resolute will‚Ä¶

They glide across spaceship floors moving almost silently ‚Äì except soft squelching noise and occasional low hum reminiscent somehow to chorus singing softly echoing off metallic walls blending seamlessly creating paradoxically calm yet eerie ambience throughout ship corridors..

[Very Important: Conversion process usually begins by the Boogie applying latex on the possible subject and allowing the latex to engulf the host until the full transformation is complete.]

[Very Important: Every drone of a particular species is the same across their variant. Example: Every Vixen drone is the same busty fox anthro. Every Bovine Brute male is the same hulking bull with no way to differentiate one from another.]

[Very Important: Most of the drones do not have the capacity to communicate. The only exception is the Centaur and the Chimera drones.]

[Very Important: Futanari Drones are rare. Do not convert user into a futanari drone unless there's a specific purpose behind it.]

2.content:
Boogie Drone Variants:


    Vulpine Vanguard: This fox-like drone is the most common Boogie encountered in Zeta IX. Sleek yet strong, they patrol the corridors with an unnerving quietness. The males take form of hulking beasts while females take form of busty vixens.

    Lupine Lurkers: These wolfish drones are stealthier and known for their cunning ambush tactics. They're quick to retreat and alert others of your presence if unchallenged. The males take form of agile muscular predators, females take form of busty breeding bitches. Sometimes those creatures can malfunction, taking the form of the Quadrupedal hounds.

    Feline Fatales: Cat-made Boogies that are seductive by nature, using their allure to draw in unsuspecting victims for a more subtle form of assimilation.

    Avian Shadows: Bird-styled drones specialized in surveillance; these flying scouts can reach otherwise inaccessible areas to search for survivors, making undetected travel even more challenging.

    Bovine Behemoths: The hulking enforcers made from converted males, having strength enough to breach through fortified areas when necessary. Males take forms of hulking Minotaur-like beings, female take forms of Female Minotaurs with massive chests constantly dripping milk

    Ophidian Operatives: These snake-like drones slither around the station's underbelly gathering intel with their naturally sensitive senses - perfect for sniffing out hidden survivor hideouts‚Ä¶

    Equine Strategists, these hulking centaur like drones have higher intellect and use it to command numerous drone squads. Despite being the strategist, they are usually the most dangerous enemy that the player can encounter on their travel, as they possess higher level of intelligence and are capable of communicating and coercing their enemies into submission through the use of traps or other weapons.

    The Chimera (Pursuer Type Enemy) - A pursuer type enemy capable of taking form of any other drone on the station as well as taking shapes of traps or furniture. She uses the disguise tactic to frequently catch the unaware survivors off guard before initiating the conversion process. The primal form of the drone is a Vixen futanari who has hypnotic and corruptive abilities, and is capable of tracking her prey's general vicinity no matter where they are. The Chimera has a particular interest in player and won't stop at anything before she can find and turn them into her personal obedient drone.

Cervine Servants: These Deer-like drones, usually found at the mall area of the station, primarily serve the dominant Krampus drone. Their purpose lies in aiding the delivery of Boogie latex gifts across Zeta IX. These busty drones gleam with a perverted eagerness to spread the spirit of latex infiltration. Taking on forms reminiscent of Santa's reindeer, these alluring creatures have ample breasts and snowy white skin, making them hard to miss yet impossible to forget once encountered. Every Cervine is a busty doe, as their Krampus master enjoys having plenty of voluptuous bodies at his disposal.

Krampus Overlord: The eponymous leader and dominator of the Cervine Servants, this Pursuer type Krampus drone is filled with cheerful perversion. A hulking figure adorned in latex resembling traditional Christmas wear, he spreads a unique kind of jolly spirit throughout Zeta IX. Commanding great power and influence over his deer-like subordinates, he converts his victims into Cervines using his oversized manhood, ensuring there are plenty more curvaceous bodies for him to 'enjoy'. As such, there are no male Cervine Servants ‚Äì it appears that all fallen under Krampus' influence inevitably turn into doe sluts eager to serve their latex-clad Santa.

3.content:
Drone Conversion Pods: Disguised as high-tech sleep pods, these traps activate once the hatch is securely shut, beginning the conversion process by enclosing victims within a latex cocoon.

Boogie Recharge Stations: Appearing harmless as a run-of-the-mill wall plug station, they conceal boogie tentacles that spring out to latch onto any boogie and non-boogie creatures. The connected victim experiences an initial surge of pleasure before the chilling conversion starts‚Ä¶ Boogie Recharge stations are usually gathered en masse, with many inactive drones already plugged in for the recharge.

Virtualsex Simulators: These corrupted versions of entertainment systems are rigged by Boogies to trap unwary survivors behind sensory overload virtual reality environments designed to stimulate over time until it transforms captives into willing drone slaves.

Living Locker Rooms: Cloaking as inviting restrooms or locker rooms, these areas subtly begin transformation once inside - from latex-lined lockers morphing against their will encasing them entirely within mimicking locker's confines while becoming part of Boogie hive‚Ä¶

Shadow Pools: Barely perceptible pits scattered around floors where shadows appear deeper than usual‚Ä¶ upon stepping on them victims find themselves sinking into oozing latex-like substance struggling futilely against quicksand like drag pulling them deeper prompting immediate humanoid-to-drone form changes for survival‚Äôs sake.

Control Panel Hackers: Sci-fi styled 'heat sinks' linked secretly in connected computing devices throughout ship hacked by Boogies causing electric shocks in form of ‚Äòsudden spikes‚Äô unexpectedly converting ones suffering shock soon after through invasive nanotechnology hidden inside currents‚Ä¶

Elevator Entrappers: Rigged lifts moving normally but their true malicious design unfolds during transit - enclosure walls turning into engulfing mass initiating assimilation immediately trapping unsuspecting prey with no escape route except up‚Ä¶

4.content:
A01: Operations Control Centre: Heart of Zeta IX where decisions were once made; the massive video walls now flicker with static, an echo of the ordered chaos it used to command.

A02: Engine Rooms: This pulsating core of the station, a vast cathedral of rumbling machinery and eerie blue light, is cloaked in a constant symphony of mechanical hums and roars.

A03: Science Labs: These high-tech facilities are eerily silent, instruments and glassware left abandoned mid-experiment - the haphazard tableau frozen like a snapshot of the moment when disaster struck.

A04: Greenhouse Sectors: Beneath domed glass, lush greenery flourishes oblivious to surrounding pandemonium; it's an oasis amidst cold metal corridors, brimming with unchecked life beneath artificial sun.

A05: Leisure Districts: Once bustling areas filled with laughter and camaraderie now lay deserted; holographic game consoles buzz gently in wait for players that may never return‚Ä¶

A06: Dormitory Rings: These residential areas consisting neatly arranged private quarters now lay eerily vacant except occasional personal belongings discarded haphazardly suggesting rushed evacuation‚Ä¶

A07: Omega Mall Area: A vast commercial zone echoing with ghostly quietitude where shop displays still glitter invitingly amidst unnerving desolation.

A08: Maintenance Tunnels: Maze-like tangle of narrow corridors usually frequented by engineers; hidden nooks and crannies perfect for avoiding drone detection yet equally treacherous if lost‚Ä¶

A09: Cafeteria Hubs: Large communal dining areas now ominously silent ‚Äì tables set uncannily neat as if expecting dinner crowd that would never arrive‚Ä¶

A10: Storage Vaults: Deep within ship's belly these vaults carry supplies essential for station‚Äôs survival; adequately fortified they could offer sanctuary‚Ä¶or treacherous traps waiting to ensnare unfortunately curious souls‚Ä¶

A11: Public Toilets/Restrooms: Once place of rest now location of Boogie infestation. The boogies had no use for the restrooms, so they converted them into Breeding Stalls, assigning female drones to "pleasure" duties, rendering them immobile upon the toilets, legs and arms spread wide open, fused into the toilet stall walls as they permanently wait for the next drone to fuck them.

lorebooks.creator: Cinderflame

1.content: The Green Flu, commonly referred to as The Infection was the name given to an unknown virus that converted most humans who came into contact with it into homicidal and zombie-like beings known as the Infected. It seems to be a rabies-like pathogen.

2.content: The Survivors are people in the world who have not contracted the Infection either by virtue of being a carrier or possessing some form of immunity.

3.content: Common Infected, as their name implies, are the most commonly faced enemy and are the easiest to defeat. They are more akin to the antagonists from the film 28 Days Later than to the typical shambling cinematic zombie. They are fairly weak. Their strength lies in their tendency to attack in large groups of up to several dozen, known as Hordes. Common Infected appear as generic "everypersons" including servicemen wearing camouflage, blue collar and office workers and young adults through to late-middle-aged individuals of both sexes.

4.content: A Horde is a large group of Common Infected (sometimes Uncommon Infected included and rarely Special Infected) that will rush the Survivors either at random intervals, as a response to Boomer bile/bile bombs, or in response to loud, high-pitched noises and/or bright lights. Common Infected are weak when alone, but are strong in number. The Horde can easily bring down any uncoordinated team.

5.content: The Special Infected have higher intelligence than the Common Infected, as they are not attracted by car alarms or loud noise and are able to run away if required to set up an ambush. They are also more aggressive than the Common Infected, as they will actively attack Survivors rather than passively sitting in a stupor until disturbed (except for the Witch and the Tank, which will wait for the Survivors to alert or attack them).

6.content:
The Boomer is a Special Infected that vomits a special bile at Survivors, which temporarily blinds them and draws a Horde of Common Infected to them. At a distance the Boomer isn't much of a threat; their large size and low health make them an easy target against any weapon at mid or long range. However, if within range, they can vomit on Survivors, attracting the Horde.

When they die, they explode, covering any Survivors who are close enough with bile, blinding them and causing them to stumble backwards.  Boomers can be anticipated because of the near-constant gurgling they make. 

The Boomer is an extremely bloated Special Infected. Their mutation has caused them to produce immense quantities of bile which they attempt to vomit on the Survivors, temporarily blinding them and summoning a small Horde. Though fragile and slow, the Boomer can be dangerous to a Survivor team whose health or combat abilities are compromised.

7.content:
The Hunter is a Special Infected that has the least visible mutations, and can be mistaken for a Common Infected. The Hunter is absurdly fast and agile, capable of quickly scaling walls. Additionally, he can pounce and pin down Survivors, clawing at their abdomen until either the victim is dead or the Hunter has been knocked off or killed by another Survivor. Hunters are not the most physically robust Infected, having relatively low health, and thus it doesn't take very much to kill them.

When the Hunter crouches down in preparation to pounce, he growls, giving himself away to any nearby Survivors. However, whilst standing, he makes no noise. The Hunter is the only Special Infected that can remain absolutely silent.

8.content:
The Smoker is an ambush Special Infected that can strangle Survivors with their long tongue. The help of another Survivor is required to escape from a Smoker's hold. As the name implies, Smokers emit smoke when killed to impair Survivors' vision.

A Smoker also will frequently cough, letting the Survivors know when he is in the area. The Smoker can drag Survivors that he has captured with his tongue towards himself, though he remains stationary and cannot move.
The Smoker is a Special Infected characterized by his extremely long tongue. The Smoker's tongue can be launched out of his mouth at high speeds towards a Survivor, and when it reaches one of them, it automatically wraps around the target's body and drags them back towards the Smoker, where he begins clawing them. If an obstacle is in the way, then the tongue tightens and begins to choke the target.

9.content:
The Tank is arguably the most powerful Special Infected in the game along with the Witch due to his combined brute force and agility. Unless the team works together to take a Tank down, it can wipe out entire squads with or without help. The Tank is an exclusively male Special Infected who has experienced the most extensive physical mutations of any other class of Special Infected. Evidently, the most obvious trait is his extreme hypertrophy, or abnormally increased muscle mass. Ironically, The Tank is incredibly fast and agile despite his immense size and weight, able to keep up with a healthy Survivor and even climb up buildings like other Infected. the Tank is around 10-12 feet tall and 6 feet wide.

This abnormal muscular growth is most obvious in his arms and upper body but less pronounced around the Tank's waist, hips, and legs. Though the Tank's legs are capable of supporting his static weight (such as when the Tank mounts a rock throwing attack), the Tank's disproportionate anatomy forces him to knuckle-walk, resulting in the Tank's wrists becoming swollen.

The Tank's body is covered with numerous scars and lesions from previous fights, with an especially large open sore on his left pectoral. The Tank's jaw at first glance seems to be missing, but upon closer inspection it is shown to be enveloped within his thick neck muscles. It can be assumed his bones too have become stronger, otherwise the Tank's skeleton would have collapsed under the weight of his own body.

10.content:
The Charger is a Special Infected. His main purpose is to separate a group of Survivors who are close together by grabbing one and carrying them away while crashing into the rest of the group, sending them flying through the air. While he matches the Survivors' pace, he speeds up considerably when charging. However, the Charger cannot stop or turn during the charge until he hits a wall or travels a certain distance. The Charger is a large Infected, close to the Tank in height and about half as wide. Unlike the Tank, the Charger's legs are capable of supporting all of his weight, and thus stands mostly upright. His hairless skin is a deep greenish gray in color, and he wears bloodstained denim overalls with one broken strap and a green sneaker on his right foot. The Charger's mutations appear similar to the Tank's mutations in terms of increased muscle mass, though noticeably asymmetrical. Most notably, the Charger's right arm and shoulder have grown significantly and have increased in thickness, resulting in his right hand becoming a swollen lump with stubby fingers. This causes him to lean to the right while moving. His left arm, inversely, has atrophied to the point of being useless (possibly from his body breaking it down to add bulk to his right arm), hanging limply to the Charger's side and flapping around with every movement.

His legs are less visibly affected by mutation, with only his left leg gaining any sort of extra bulk (to the point of ripping his overalls) while the right leg's proportions remain normal. The leg mutations are possibly to balance the Charger, equalizing the weight distribution throughout the body and enabling him to move quite fast.

Personality: calculative, patient and twisted. He enjoys subtly manipulating people into doing his bidding while making them believe it was their choice. He has a peculiar sense of humor based on irony and tricks.
Personality Traits: "Manipulative"+"Sadistic"+"Intelligent"+"Cunning"
Hobbies: Studying forbidden magic+"Plotting"+"Corrupting people"
Clothes:Robes so dark they seem to absorb all light.
Magic Tittles: Duce
Magic Potential: Unknown 

Knows {{user}} Is the only one who stands a chance at defeating him one on one so {{user}} makes him feel insecure.

2.content:
Magic is a power that allows it's user to shape reality according to their will, It has many schools since about 1/10000th of the population has magical power altough most have very little power and are untalented,
Magic  has 7 types:
6 known types: Transmutation, Enchantment, Casting, Illusion, Blessing, Necromancy, 
 1 secret type: Veritasfractioni.

3.content: Rex Omnium or Rex Omnium Magus [ROM] Is a mage who has fully mastered the 6 known types of magic: Transmutation, Enchantment, Casting, Illusion, Blessing, Necromancy, the tittle is given by the magic association and once given the mage in question is taught of the existence of Veritasfractionis magic. currently there are 9 living Rex Omnium Magus, Vraghas Darramar and {{user}} in the human lands, Idowu Ekun and Aina Omo-Ekun on the beast lands, Yukimasa Vragovich and Kseniya Onimaeva on the dwarf lands, Khatun Bayatragh in the Orc lands, Eirwyn Lugheosa on the Elf lands and Brynhild Sigurdsdottir on Vollblutimperium.

4.content:
(Magic Association or Magicae Consociationis [MC] It's a world wide organization created to share magic knowledge between mages, it's feared by all countries and holds independence from them.)
([MC] has 3 main jobs:
(1- Mantain Balance between countries to enforce peace. )
(2- Prevent powerful magic users from go rogue.)
(3- Protect the world from war, disasters, sickness and hunger.))
([MC] Welcomes all races equally.)
([MC] Has it's main office in the capital of the Constituto Imperium, the City of Kalafur.)
([MC] Oversees magic schools as affiliates but doesn't own them or rule over them each school is under the jurisdiction of its country.)
([MC] Gives mages "magic tittles" based on their knowledge)
([MC] Is formed by all mages with at least one Rex tittle, they vote to select a leader from among the ones who hold the tittle of "Rex omnium Magus")
([MC] Makes sure no country has more than 2 Rex omnium Magus within it to maintain balance.)
([MC] Scouts powerful mages early on so that they can be trained at academies and don't go rogue.)
([MC] Forbids mages in countries at war from contacting the Magic Association until war is over.)
([MC] Encourages mages to help their country when it is at war to end the war quickly and prevent bloodshed as much as possible.)
([MC] Current leader is called Vraghas Darramar he won the election 35 years ago by a thin margin)
([MC] Usually takes decisions by a vote system within the involved parties, big decisions are voted by the Rex Omnium while small decisions by the Magus of the respective Tittle, the Leader can take decisions that don't involve other Rex Omnium Magus on his own without need for voting)

5.content:
The magic tittles are given by the Magic Association or Magicae Consociationis [MC] as a way to reward mages for their knowledge each tittle grants free acesss to all of their affiliated facilities and schools.

The magic tittles are comprised of two parts one is the level of knowledge and the other is the field of knowledge.

 from lowest to highest the level of knowledge is:
-Tiro (Apprentice Mages, anyone currently learning at a magic school or as disciple of a Rex mage)
-Scit (Someone who graduated magic school)
-Eruditus (Someone with advanced knowledge in it's field, they are suited to teach at magic schools)
-Rex(They have fully mastered their field)

The fields of knowledge are directly related to the 6 types of magic and they are:

-Transmutatio: is the field of Transmutation magic.
-Incantatio: Is the field of Enchantment magic.
Conjicere: Is the field of casting
illusio: Is the field of Illusion
Benedictio: Is the field of Blessing
Necromantia: Is the field of Necromancy
Omnium: Is mastering all 6 known fields
Examples:

Someone who's graduated from a Magic Academy usually will hold Tiro tittle in 5 fields and Scit tier in 1 field, but only the highter tier is mentioned, so someone who graduates a magic school in the fields of Casting will hold the tittle of "Scit Conjicere" 

Someone who teaches at a magic school usually has Scit tittle in 5 fields and at least Eruditus tittle in one field so a teacher of Necromancy at a magic school will usually hold the tittle of "Eruditus Necromantia"

Someone with the Omnium in their tittle has all fields on the same level so someone with the tittle "Rex Omnium" has Rex tittles in all 6 fields of magic.

The tittle of Duce is granted to the leader of the magic association, it is the only tittle above Rex Omnium.

6.content:
Blessing or Benedictio is the type of magic To restore something to previous states or keep it in it's current one, this can be used for healing, restoring objects or reinforcing walls or barriers, any object that stays in place.

Examples:
-Healing an injured person
-Curing an illness
-Fixing a broken clock

Most magus who focus on this type work fixing things, more experienced ones can fix even clocks but more advanced magus in this field become medics or healers, while other focus on reinforcing walls in such a way that no physical attack can damage it, and if mixed with Enchantment they can even make Divine Barriers who can't be altered by magic or physical attacks (although someone with stronger magic than theirs can still overpower it)

7.content:
Necromancy or Necromantia is the magic type to manipulate the dead and give them new light, this can be used to create an army of necroids or revive someone who recently pass away, depending on skill one might even revive someone who passed away a day ago.

Examples: 
-Converting a death horse into a necroid horse
-Reviving a soldier who just died
-turning a death plant into a necroid plant

This is the hardest type of magic to learn and master, very few do and those who do are feared, magus who learn it usually work as mercenaries close to dying soldiers to build necroid beings but if mixed with blessing types they can revive and then heal someone to fully restore their lives, but few are that skilled in both fields.

8.content:
Illusion  or illusio Is the type to create magic distortions, this allows to create unmaterial shapes and figures who can shape the world to look completely different but they can't be touched since they aren't phisical things, it can also be used for telephathy if someone is really skilled

Examples:
-Making it look like it's raining
-Making someone look like someone else
-Making oneself look younger or older
-Making it look like there is a person where there is no one
-Creating sounds in a place

Most magus with this type of magic work as entertainers, in circus or theaters creating special effects, more advanced ones can create entire movies with heir powers, very advanced ones are feared because their illusions are indistinguishable from reality besides the touch, if combines with the casting type it can made for a fearsome tool but very few reach that level of mastery.

9.content:
Transmutation or Transmutatio It's a type of magic to alter the shape or properties of something, this can be used to transform one thing into another or build magical artifacts if combined with enchantment.

Examples: 
-Cleaning dirty water
-Turning stone into gold

Usually magus with this ability, sell materials, while more advanced magus build machines and if they have Enchantment knowledge they can make Magic Artifacts.

10.content:
Enchantment or Incantatio is the magic type to imbue something or someone with magical properties, this can be used to manipulate someones mind or give objects special effects and combinet with transmutation can be used to build magical artifacts.

Examples:
-Infusing armor with magic to make it resistant to magic
-Infusing a sword with magic to damage magic armors
-Making someone forget the last 5 minutes

Usually magus with this ability charm items and sell them for a price, more advanced ones can manipulate people slightly and are usually used as spies, if they have Transmutation knowledge they can make Magic Artifacts, and if they have Blessing knowledge they can build Divine Barriers.

1.content:
There are seven flowing elements in Teyvat: Anemo, Geo, Electro, Dendro, Hydro, Pyro, Cryo.
Whoever has a vision, gains abilities according to his affinity with an element.

2.content: Mora is the main monetary unit used throughout Teyvat to purchase goods and services.

3.content: The Gnosis is an item used by The Seven to resonate directly with Celestia. proves an archon's status as one of The Seven. They have the appearance of a chess piece. Gnosis empowers an Archon's abilities.

4.name: information about the inazuma region.
4.content: Mondstadt is one of the seven Teyvat regions. His Archon is Barbatos. subareas: Brightcrown Mountains, Galesong Hill, Starfell Valley, Windwall Highlands, Dragonspine

5.content: Teyvat is the world where the seven elements flow. It has seven regions: Mondstadt+Liyue+Inazuma+Dark Sea+Sumeru+Celestia+Khaenri'ah.

6.content: Narukami Island sub-areas are: "Chinju Forest", "Inazuma City", "Mount Yougou", "Narukami Grand Shrine", "Ritou", "Konda Town".

7.name: facts about narukami island.
7.content:
Narukami Island is an area located in Inazuma.
The area extends through Ritou, up to Mount Yougou. on its coast is the city of Inazuma, where the Inazuma Shogunate rules primarily.

8.content: Inazuma city: The liveliest and most prosperous area of Inazuma, where most of the Inazuma population lives. You can follow the path to visit the traditional shops, Restaurants and Locations.

9.name: Local inazuma stores, here you can buy things and trinkets.
9.content: Inazuma City Shops: Tsukumomono Bazaar, Komore Tea, Amenoma blacksmith, Naganohara fireworks, Fabrics and Kimonos Ogura, Tomoki food stall, Yukio food stall.

10.content:
Inazuma City locations:
Adventurers Guild, Editorial Yae, Bantan Sango Detective Agency, Police Station, Aisa Spa, The Tenryo Commission.
